md:
giải nghĩa từ "penalty" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

* Penalty (noun) - Hình phạt
	+ Meaning: a punishment or penalty imposed for breaking a rule or law.
	+ Example: "The team was given a penalty for unsportsmanlike conduct."
	+ Related words: fine, punishment, sanction, consequence.

* Penalty (noun) - Điểm phạt
	+ Meaning: a point or points deducted from a player's or team's score as a penalty.
	+ Example: "The golfer incurred a penalty stroke for hitting the ball out of bounds."
	+ Related words: deduction, demerit, minus, subtraction.

* Penalty (noun) - Lãi suất phạt
	+ Meaning: a charge or fee imposed for a financial transaction, such as a late payment or overdraft.
	+ Example: "The bank charged a penalty fee for the overdraft."
	+ Related words: fine, surcharge, interest, charge.

* Penalty (verb) - Phạt
	+ Meaning: to impose a penalty or punishment on someone.
	+ Example: "The referee penalized the player for holding onto the ball too long."
	+ Related words: punish, fine, sanction, penalize.
html:
giải nghĩa từ "penalty" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

  • Penalty (noun) - Hình phạt

    • Meaning: a punishment or penalty imposed for breaking a rule or law.
    • Example: "The team was given a penalty for unsportsmanlike conduct."
    • Related words: fine, punishment, sanction, consequence.

  • Penalty (noun) - Điểm phạt

    • Meaning: a point or points deducted from a player's or team's score as a penalty.
    • Example: "The golfer incurred a penalty stroke for hitting the ball out of bounds."
    • Related words: deduction, demerit, minus, subtraction.

  • Penalty (noun) - Lãi suất phạt

    • Meaning: a charge or fee imposed for a financial transaction, such as a late payment or overdraft.
    • Example: "The bank charged a penalty fee for the overdraft."
    • Related words: fine, surcharge, interest, charge.

  • Penalty (verb) - Phạt

    • Meaning: to impose a penalty or punishment on someone.
    • Example: "The referee penalized the player for holding onto the ball too long."
    • Related words: punish, fine, sanction, penalize.
